section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 20. Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > j. Terrorism Guidelines > 2) Cause of an injury is suspected to be the result of terrorism

content.full_text: When the cause of an injury is suspected to be the result of terrorism a code from category Y38 should not be assigned. Suspected cases should be classified as assault. (Evidence: pg no: 92, L47-L48)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding suspected terrorism cases - do not use Y38 codes, classify as assault instead (Evidence: pg no: 92, L47-L48)
key_concepts: Suspected terrorism does not use Y38 codes (Evidence: pg no: 92, L47-L48)
Suspected cases classified as assault (Evidence: pg no: 92, L48)
Distinction between confirmed and suspected terrorism (Evidence: pg no: 92, L47-L48)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not assign Y38 codes for suspected terrorism (Evidence: pg no: 92, L47-L48)
detailed_rules.explanation: When terrorism is only suspected but not confirmed by the FBI, do not use codes from category Y38 (Evidence: pg no: 92, L47-L48)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Classify suspected terrorism cases as assault (Evidence: pg no: 92, L48)
detailed_rules.explanation: When terrorism is suspected but not confirmed, use assault codes instead of terrorism codes (Evidence: pg no: 92, L48)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if terrorism is confirmed by FBI or only suspected
Step 2: If only suspected, do not use Y38 codes
Step 4: Use appropriate assault external cause codes
